raw_mentions:
The 11β-HSD1 inhibitors of structural formula I generally have an inhibition constant IC50 of less than about 500 nM, and preferably less than about 100 nM.
Generally, the IC50 ratio for 11β-HSD2 to 11β-HSD1 of a compound is at least about two or more, and preferably about ten or greater.
Even more preferred are compounds with an IC50 ratio for 11β-HSD2 to 11β-HSD1 of about 100 or greater.
For example, compounds of the present invention ideally demonstrate an inhibition constant IC50 against 11β-HSD2 greater than about 1000 nM, and preferably greater than 4000 nM.
